page.title: 07Houses of Interest 1
page.content: RED HOW: This is perhaps the most important building in the area.It is owned by the Dickinson family and has been in their possession since it was built in 1822. The original building was of sandstone but the more recent extensions are roughcast.There have been a number of alterations since John Dickinson built it.The original house had four rooms up and four down.Mr.George Dickinson added a wing on both ends and intended to put in bow windows but this was not completed because of World War One. The rooms are ten feet high and cost a great deal to heat as a consequence. Under the house is a cellar and outside in the garden there used to be a well and a pump for the water. (cont.)
